intro: Knautia sylvatica var. ressmannii, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
